<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 292]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 858, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 213, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 316, 89]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 97, 576, 155]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} - 1 & 2 & 12 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 3 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 163, 500, 183]]<|/det|>
Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 193, 562, 214]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A}^{4} = p\mathbf{A}^{2} + q\mathbf{I},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 226, 465, 245]]<|/det|>
where \(p\) and \(q\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 84, 148, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 487, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2y}{\mathrm{dx}^2}\) at the point \((-1, 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 83, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 88, 902, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 291, 917, 330]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \frac{\ln x}{x^2}\) for \(x \geqslant 2\), together with a set of \((N - 2)\) rectangles of unit width.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 343, 146, 361]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 342, 672, 361]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 375, 625, 419]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{N}\frac{\ln r}{r^2} < \frac{2 + 3\ln 2}{4} - \frac{1 + \ln N}{N}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 388, 920, 408]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 85, 146, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 710, 109]]<|/det|>
Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(N\), a lower bound for \(\sum_{r=1}^{N} \frac{\ln r}{r^2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 84, 918, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 71, 544, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 106, 594, 141]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} -2\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} +y = 4\cos x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 158, 468, 186]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(x = 0\), \(y = -4\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 163, 920, 181]]<|/det|>
<mark>[11]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 457, 89]]<|/det|>
Use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 109, 660, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\csc \sec 5\theta = \frac{\csc \sec^5\theta}{5\csc \sec^4\theta - 20\csc \sec^2\theta + 16}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 116, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 455, 88]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the roots of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 101, 603, 120]]<|/det|>
\[x^{5} - 10x^{4} + 40x^{2} - 32 = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 490, 152]]<|/det|>
in the form \(\mathrm{cos}\mathrm{ec}(q\pi)\), where \(q\) is rational.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 520, 90]]<|/det|>
Show that an appropriate integrating factor for

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 96, 623, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\sqrt{x^{2} - 1}\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +y = x^{2} - x\sqrt{x^{2} - 1}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 129, 276, 151]]<|/det|>
is \(x + \sqrt{x^{2} - 1}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 554, 89]]<|/det|>
Hence find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 97, 623, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\sqrt{x^{2} - 1}\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +y = x^{2} - x\sqrt{x^{2} - 1}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 131, 698, 152]]<|/det|>
for which \(y = 1\) when \(x = \frac{5}{4}\). Give your answer in the form \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 714, 91]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definition of cosh in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 101, 594, 121]]<|/det|>
\[2\cosh^{2}A = \cosh 2A + 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 320, 416, 339]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 348, 717, 371]]<|/det|>
\[x = 2\cosh 2t + 3t,\quad y = \textstyle {\frac{3}{2}}\cosh 2t - 4t,\quad \mathrm{for} - \textstyle {\frac{1}{2}}\leqslant t\leqslant \textstyle {\frac{1}{2}}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 380, 920, 416]]<|/det|>
The area of the surface generated when \(C\) is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(y\)-axis is denoted by \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 425, 144, 444]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 422, 180, 444]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 420, 576, 453]]<|/det|>
Show that \(A = 10\pi \int_{-\frac{1}{2}}^{\frac{1}{2}} (2\cosh 2t + 3t)\cosh 2t \mathrm{~d}t\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 426, 920, 445]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 453, 917, 475]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 735, 917, 754]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 774, 917, 794]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 814, 917, 833]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 853, 917, 873]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 893, 917, 912]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 922, 917, 942]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 73, 181, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 457, 90]]<|/det|>
Hence find \(A\) in terms of \(\pi\) and e.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 90]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 73, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
# Additional Page
